parts.text:
**Assignment: Simple Blog Post Layout**

**Objective:** Create the foundational layout for a basic blog post using HTML and CSS.

**Requirements:**

1.  **HTML Structure:** Set up an `index.html` file with the following main sections inside a central wrapper `div`:
    *   A `header` section (e.g., for a blog title).
    *   A `main` content section (e.g., for a post title, a dummy image, and a few paragraphs of text).
    *   A `footer` section (e.g., for copyright info).
2.  **CSS Styling:** In a `style.css` file, link it to your HTML.
    *   Ensure all three sections are visually distinct (e.g., different background colors, borders, or padding).
    *   The main wrapper `div` should be centered horizontally on the page and have a fixed maximum width.

---
**Visual Guide:**

```
+------------------------------------+
|             Page / Body            |
| +--------------------------------+ |
| |        Main Container          | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| | |           Header           | | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| | |        Main Content        | | |
| | |      (Title, Image, Text)  | | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| | |           Footer           | | |
| | +----------------------------+ | |
| +--------------------------------+ |
+------------------------------------+
```

---
**Submission:**
Package your `index.html` and `style.css` files into a single `.zip` file and submit it to your teacher.
